name: Pistachio Green Ombre 240 yard mini-skein sets Silken Sock
description:
IMPORTANT: I will be out of town from December 18th through January 1st for the holidays. The shop will stay open, but please be aware that any order you place during that time will not ship until I return. 

By popular demand! Higher yardage mini-skein sets! These skeins have approximately 40 yards per skein, for a total of 240 yards. So many things you can do with these! Colourwork, socks, mitts, hats, baby items, a rainbow in a scarf….the possibilities are endless. 

Yarn: 80/20 superwash merino/silk Silken Sock
Fingering weight-- u.s. 0-2 needles suggested.

Mini-Skein sets are not available for custom orders, but are repeatable, so if there is popular demand for a particular colourway, another batch will be dyed and posted in the shop. 

We do our best to photograph our items accurately, but please bear in mind that color settings can vary from monitor to monitor, so some discrepancy between the digital image and the physical item is common.

name: Spring Green Ombre Silken Sock mini skein set
description: IMPORTANT: I will be out of town from December 18th through January 1st for the holidays. The shop will stay open, but please be aware that any order you place during that time will not ship until I return. These sets are so adorable you'll want to keep them in the package and just look at them! But if you can bring yourself to open it, you will find 6 skeins of approximately 20 yards each of our 80/20 superwash merino/silk Silken Sock. The lustre and shine of this yarn makes the colours glow. Use these for colorwork, hexapuff blankets, accessories, baby items, granny squares-- any thing and everything you can dream of! Just a few pattern ideas: "Leftie" by Martina Behm, (for the stripes) "Beekeeper's Quilt" by Tiny Owl Knits, Hexagon Mitts by Sybil R (also free!), Little Fair Isle Hat by Purl Soho (use for the color work)….oh, so many ideas! We do our best to photograph our items accurately, but please bear in mind that color settings can vary from monitor to monitor, so some discrepancy between the digital image and the physical item is common.

name: TLS Rose Coronet 60/20/20 merino/yak/silk OOAK
description:
IMPORTANT: I will be out of town from December 18th through January 1st for the holidays. The shop will stay open, but please be aware that any order you place during that time will not ship until I return. 

Holy cow, this is a fabulous fibre blend. Incredibly soft, silky, and smooth. The yak and the merino make it downy soft; the silk adds shine and strength. Pure pleasure to spin.

This colourway  is part of The Luminosity Project and is non-repeatable. All colourways in The Luminosity Project are built up with multiple layers of dye, resulting in a one-of-a-kind yarn that glows. Base yarns may be limiited editions as well. 


We do our best to photograph our items accurately, but please bear in mind that color settings can vary from monitor to monitor, so some discrepancy between the digital image and the physical item is common.

Each 4 oz of fiber is dyed individually, so no two are going to be exactly alike.

name: Malachite superwash merino sport
description:
IMPORTANT: I will be out of town from December 18th through January 1st for the holidays. The shop will stay open, but please be aware that any order you place during that time will not ship until I return. 

This yarn is simply a great all-purpose yarn. It is neither delicate nor tough, neither drapey nor stiff. Its multiple plies gives it a wonderful roundness that shows off stitch definition to perfection. This yarn only softens more as you knit with it and will wear wonderfully, making it truly a versatile yarn-- use it for socks, baby items, garments, hats, accessories-- it will suit all of those perfectly.

180 yards per skein
3-5 u.s. needles suggested

We try to send matched skeins, but if you need a specific amount for a large project, it is best to contact us to do a custom order so that the yarns may be from the same dye lot. Solids are dyed in batches of 6-8, multi-colours are dyed two at a time, so it is always best to alternate skeins. You may seem some speckles of other colours; this is normal and a natural part of the dye process. 


We do our best to photograph our items accurately, but please bear in mind that color settings can vary from monitor to monitor, so some discrepancy between the digital image and the physical item is common.

name: Aubergine 60/40 merino/silk Bacchus Aran
description: IMPORTANT: I will be out of town from December 18th through January 1st for the holidays. The shop will stay open, but please be aware that any order you place during that time will not ship until I return. Luscious is the best adjective for this amazing, lustrous yarn. Bacchus Aran is 60% merino, and 40% silk, resulting in a glowing, super soft yarn that also has fantastic stitch definition. It's perfect for garments, accessories....anything you can think of. And at 220 yards per skein, it's a great deal. There are a number of marvellous patterns that use this yarn, if you need some ideas: Open Plan and Golden Wheat Cardigan by Veera Valimaki, Lanewayby Cecily Glowik Macdonald, and Lazy Jacks Hat by Amy Christoffers. aran weight: 7-9 u.s. needles Need a larger quantity? Just contact us! We do our best to photograph our items accurately, but please bear in mind that color settings can vary from monitor to monitor, so some discrepancy between the digital image and the physical item is common. We try to send matched skeins, but if you need a specific amount for a large project, it is best to contact us to do a custom order so that the yarns may be from the same dye lot. Solids are dyed in batches of 5-8, multi-colours are dyed two at a time, so it is always best to alternate skeins. You may seem some speckles of other colours; this is normal and a natural part of the dye process.

name: Glowing Orange handspun mixed BFL/silk sport weight
description:
IMPORTANT: I will be out of town from December 18th through January 1st for the holidays. The shop will stay open, but please be aware that any order you place during that time will not ship until I return. 

Approximately 324 yards of handspun 85/15 mixed Blue-Faced Leicester/silk, two ply, with a lovely twist. The silk makes this yarn just glow! Knitting with handspun is always a special treat. 

sport weight-- 3-5 u.s. needles suggested. 

We do our best to photograph our items accurately, but please bear in mind that color settings can vary from monitor to monitor, so some discrepancy between the digital image and the physical item is common.

name: Robin's Egg superwash merino worsted
description:
IMPORTANT: I will be out of town from December 18th through January 1st for the holidays. The shop will stay open, but please be aware that any order you place during that time will not ship until I return. 

Oh, you couldn't ask for a more squishy and soft superwash merino worsted weight yarn. Touched with that gloss that superwash has, the colours glow. It will make your fingers want to cast on immediately, it's so soft and lovely. It's perfect for <i>everything<i> -- absolutely fantastic for sweaters, perfect for blankets or baby garments or warm hats and scarves-- you think of it, it's perfect for it. And, at 200 yards per skein, you get a lot of yardage for your money!

Worsted weight-- size 5-7 u.s. needles suggested, but always swatch first!


Need a larger quantity? Just contact us!

We try to send matched skeins, but if you need a specific amount for a large project, it is best to contact us to do a custom order so that the yarns may be from the same dye lot. Solids are dyed in batches of 5-8, multi-colours are dyed two at a time, so it is always best to alternate skeins. You may seem some speckles of other colours; this is normal and a natural part of the dye process. 

We do our best to photograph our items accurately, but please bear in mind that color settings can vary from monitor to monitor, so some discrepancy between the digital image and the physical item is common.

Superwash merino is one of my all time favourite fibers to spin. Why? Because the silky smoothness can be addictive! It's also so versatile-- good for socks, but also good for so much more, plus the superwash factor means no felting!

name: Saffron Blue-Faced Leicester
description:
IMPORTANT: I will be out of town from December 18th through January 1st for the holidays. The shop will stay open, but please be aware that any order you place during that time will not ship until I return. 

Blue-Faced Leicester is a marvellously versatile wool; it is fine enough to be soft next to the skin, it has durability, is shiny enough to take dye beautifully, and can be felted. It's springy and soft and easy to spin, making it a great fiber for beginning or experienced spinners. Our BFL is so soft to touch it and sproingy that it just begs to be spun! 

Need a larger quantity? Just contact us!

We do our best to photograph our items accurately, but please bear in mind that color settings can vary from monitor to monitor, so some discrepancy between the digital image and the physical item is common.

Each 4 oz of fiber is dyed individually, so no two are going to be exactly alike.

name: Teddy Bear 80/20 superwash merino/nylon Super Sock
description:
SUPER sock is 400 yards of soft, perfectly plied 80 % superwash merino and 20% nylon yarn. It shows stitch definition wonderfully, and is not only perfect for socks, it makes wonderful accessories and garments! 

Fingering weight: use size 0-2 u.s. needles. 

Need a larger quantity? Just contact us!

We try to send matched skeins, but if you need a specific amount for a large project, it is best to contact us to do a custom order so that the yarns may be from the same dye lot. Solids are dyed in batches of 5-8, multi-colours are dyed two at a time, so it is always best to alternate skeins. We do our best to photograph our items accurately, but please bear in mind that color settings can vary from monitor to monitor, so some discrepancy between the digital image and the physical item is common.

name: Saffron 75/25 Blue-Faced Leicester/silk
description:
Soft, springy, easy to spin Blue-Faced Leicester plus tussah silk makes a great, luxurious fiber. The yarn spun from this fiber glows from the silk and has a great amount of tensile strength. You'll love spinning this!

We do our best to photograph our items accurately, but please bear in mind that color settings can vary from monitor to monitor, so some discrepancy between the digital image and the physical item is common.
